source_text: The traditional etymology is from the Latin aperire, "to open," in allusion to its being the season when trees and flowers begin to "open".

source_text: Australia is a member of the United Nations, G-20 major economies, Commonwealth of Nations, ANZUS, OECD, and the WTO.

source_text: Australia has six states New South Wales, Queensland, South Australia, Tasmania, Victoria, and Western Australia and two major mainland territorie the Northern Territory and the Australian Capital Territory (ACT).
target_text: The states are New South Wales, Queensland, South Australia, Tasmania, Victoria, and Western Australia.

source_text: In July 2007 the population is almost 21.9 million, with approximately 60% concentrated in and around the mainland state capitals of Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane, Perth, and Adelaide.

source_text: Each state and major mainland territory has its own legislature or parliament: unicameral in the Northern Territory, the ACT, and Queensland, and bicameral in the remaining states.

source_text: Australia has participated in every summer Olympic Games of the modern era, and every Commonwealth Games.
